div.p: I send to your charity, my brother, this very old coin of Vespasian, recently found in the fields of Lenzburg, which I bought from a certain rustic man for a small price, but it is very pleasing to me due to its antiquity. Please accept this old coin as a token of our old friendship, I beseech you; now I send only this, as much as I can be to you.

If your purse desires such a coin, I desire nothing more than for it to be adorned with this one very old coin; if not, you can return it. Farewell, most excellent patron. Greet the little mother for me, etc. Farewell.
Given at Lenzburg on the 19th of October in the year 1550. With my wife returning to me, respond at least with one word.
To my dearest Bullinger in the Lord.
